Text.Value: You risked your life for Wulbren several times over - don't you think he should be a bit more grateful?
I'm not stuck. I came to find you, of course.

EditorData.NodeContext: Faux chagrin but it's really happy to see Wulbren

Text.Value: Prick.
Not really. You're a bit of a wet blanket.
With a little luck, I'll still see you at camp later.
Don't judge him too harshly. He's been through a lot. When he's had some rest, he'll be back to his usual self.
I said go home!

EditorData.NodeContext: Wulbren snaps, losing his temper at Barcus' mention of runepowder.

Text.Value: Good idea.
The very same to you. Though with your record, I very much doubt you'll need it.
There's no need for gratitude between Wulbren and myself. His interests are my interests, and vice versa.
Wulbren!
Please - that isn't necessary.

EditorData.NodeContext: Pleading with the player not to flatter him in front of Wulbren. Barcus' pride and humility.

Text.Value: Why don't you join my camp once we're ready to leave these lands?
Now! I believe our business is well and truly concluded.
I'm glad you agree. Well! I'll just - erm - stand over there. In case Wulbren needs anything.
You don't owe me, Barcus. If anything, Wulbren does.
You really care about him, don't you.
Well! Perhaps Wulbren is right. Perhaps I ought to return to Baldur's Gate.

EditorData.NodeContext: False chipperness. He was hoping for a welcome reunion with Wulbren, and now he's being sent away after being humiliated.

Text.Value: But - Wulbren - the runepowder. We need to discuss what you're going to -

EditorData.NodeContext: Barcus almost starting to plead here. There's a lot he wants to say to his friend but isn't being given the chance.

Text.Value: There we have it! Wulbren is safe and well, thanks to you. And as you so correctly pointed out, I owe you.

EditorData.NodeContext: Faking cheerfulness after being rejected by Wulbren

Text.Value: Nonsense! When you've known each other as long as we have, there aren't sides.
Let's not be uncivilised. Wulbren, perhaps we can talk more later, when you've had a moment to settle in.

EditorData.NodeContext: Trying to play peacekeeper between the playe and Wulbren.

Text.Value: Say that again.

EditorData.NodeContext: Quietly furious, almost squaring up to player

Text.Value: Unfortunately for me, you're my friend. Rescuing you from mortal peril is my right.
You don't belong here, Barcus. Soon as the Harpers give word that Moonrise has been handled, you ought to get out of here.
I'll tell you what: If I make it out alive, why don't you meet me at my camp afterward?
I doubt Wulbren agrees.
But you didn't rescue me, did you? I rescued myself, with the aid of this - helper.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Wulbren waves a hand dismissively, indicating the player on 'helper'
EditorData.NodeContext: 'Helper' applies to the player. Wulbren is being dismissive of the player's ocntributions to his escape.

Text.Value: Then it's settled. Good day to you both.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [Wulbren] turns away *possibly reuse construction or VO cover it <choicelyn>

Text.Value: That's all right. I'm a patient fellow. I'm sure you'll clear a path for everyone soon enough.

EditorData.NodeContext: Talking about waiting for the curse to be cleared, but the subtext is he's patient in general and will continue to be so with Wulbren

Text.Value: Thank you.
It is. Farewell, Barcus. And good luck.
If you'll excuse me, I have a great deal to do.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [Wulbren] turns away *possibly reuse construction or VO cover it <choicelyn>

Text.Value: Oh. That's a little sad, isn't it?
Indeed. Neither of you has any clue what's a stake - and why should you? It's Ironhand Gnome business.

EditorData.NodeContext: Frustration with Barcus and player, biting edge

Text.Value: Indeed. He does.

EditorData.NodeContext: Cowed but trying to keep his chin up.

Text.Value: I give you: The Brilliant Retort!

EditorData.stateContext: Barcus and Player present. Walbrun has left.

Text.Value: Hm. Perhaps I will. Yes - yes that's a nice idea.
That'll have to wait - it's lethal out there.
Well! Once you're used to someone, you're... used to them.

EditorData.NodeContext: subtext = he cares about wulbren more than anything in the world but is being barcusy about it

Text.Value: Of course - but a moment, if you please. Wulbren, I believe we really must discuss -

EditorData.NodeContext: Flustered; trying to fob off the player momentarily while he gets Wulbren to acknowledge him

Text.Value: I certainly hope so, or Withers will be most despondent. Look after yourself.
It's a new type of smokepowder. Powerful stuff. Made it myself.
Wulbren can be a little sharp, but so can I - you should know that better than anyone.

EditorData.NodeContext: With a touch of humour at the end.

Text.Value: You don't know what Barcus has gone through to find you.
Handy to have in the event of a fire, though. I'd say 'all the best' but we don't know each other that well, do we? All the most middling. Ta.
One and the same.
Thank you.
Why would you do a foolish thing like that? Really, Barcus.

EditorData.NodeContext: 'Really' in kind of sarcastic disbelief that Barcus would annoy him like this.

Text.Value: He's got a point, Barcus.
Your relationship seems rather one-sided.
The Brilliant Retort, for starters. Here you are, as promised.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [Barcus] passing item to player *possibly reuse construction or VO cover it <choicelyn>
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Reach behind back to retrieve Brilliant Retort. Off-camera hand off to player.

Text.Value: Sure. Now: I've business to attend to. Good day to you both.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [Wulbren] turns away *possibly reuse construction or VO cover it <choicelyn>
EditorData.NodeContext: No interet in catching up with Barcus

Text.Value: Ah. I'd heard you might be about. How the devil did you get stuck here, Barcus?
You don't know him, though. This is just his way.
I'm heading to the Towers to face Ketheric Thorm. We may not meet again.
What will you do now, Barcus?
You can fight this out on your own time. Barcus, I believe you have something for me.

EditorData.logicalname: Player is waiting for their reward.

Text.Value: Ah - it's you! I should've guessed. Thank you very much for your help finding Wulbren!
Wulbren seems like a real arsehole.
Leave.
Well! There we have it. Wulbren is safe and sound, thanks to you. I owe you a great deal.
You don't belong here, Barcus. Soon as the way is clear, pack up and head to Baldur's Gate.
Enough, Barcus. Pay your friend whatever it is you owe him and leave me out of it.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [Wulbren] turns away *possibly reuse construction or VO cover it <choicelyn>
EditorData.NodeContext: Exasperated, wants to get away from this conversation.

Text.Value: The Brilliant Retort, for starters. Here you are. I hope you'll like it.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [Barcus] passing item to player *possibly reuse construction or VO cover it <choicelyn>
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Reach behind back to retrieve Brilliant Retort. Off-camera hand off to player.
EditorData.logicalname: Didn't get reward yet, doesn't know BR

Text.Value: Leave.

Synopsis: Barcus runs up to Wulbren in Haven after Wulbren is released from MOO. This is the culmination of everything he's been working for for the whole game and is so excited to see his friend - and find out what the deal wis with the runepowder plot. Barcus is swiftly rebuked by Wulbren and left disappointed but trying to save face.
